entry.title: Mirror: The Open Source Amazon Echo
entry.content: I recently got an Amazon Echo and I love using it. From its shopping list feature to playing my Pandora stations to its “flash briefing” news podcasts, it is thoroughly enjoyable. But its $180 price tag can be a bit steep. I decided to build one only using open source tools so that all may enjoy the awesomeness of an Echo.

entry.title: Hermes: A Jasper Module for Sending SMS Messages
entry.content:
Jasper is a great platform to develop voice-controlled applications. It has excellent developer documentation that makes it easy to create your own modules. Jasper is pretty cool so I decided to start programming some modules myself.

The first is called Hermes. This module will allow you to send SMS messages to your friends and family through the Twilio API.
